header_summary:
Recent discussions across various platforms have delved into the intricacies and implications of innovations and protocols within the Bitcoin ecosystem, highlighting Payjoin's potential for privacy enhancement, the readiness for BIP3 implementation, and the release of Bitcoin Core version v29.0rc2. Yuval Kogman explored Payjoin, emphasizing its flexibility and the challenges of ensuring privacy through strategic coin selection and transaction protocols ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CALiT-Zq-WmwZCB2uJ4oq+evFerRZTwtKcct8sPRE6n+Jx3CQhQ@mail.gmail.com/T/#mc3c7795d9b6e0f0abfb4d223ae620424135071ad)). Antoine Poinsot provided insights into the latest version of BIP3, suggesting it is ready for implementation and inviting feedback, while experimenting with the format in other BIP drafts ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/25449597-c5ed-42c5-8ac1-054feec8ad88@murch.one/T/#m2d3c0093f89bf5dca505c3571bc9797c72d6882c)). Gloria Zhao announced the release candidate for Bitcoin Core version v29.0rc2, a significant step towards the new major version, encouraging community involvement for testing and feedback ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/566a1d2f-c3e7-495e-a85b-1e21f92df2d3n@googlegroups.com/T/#u#m9489b490c59f48abcd1004164685f2dcfd1b0062)).

In a different vein, discussions also touched upon the theoretical underpinnings of Bitcoin's potential as a stabilizing force in the macroeconomy, with josh arguing for its eventual dominance as the optimal unit of account and its natural capacity for encouraging economic stability without external interventions ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/a-game-theoretic-approach-to-bitcoin-s-valuation-in-equilibrium/1547)). On the technical side, the use of CheckTemplateVerify (CTV) for enhancing the security and efficiency of Lightning payments in Ark was examined, focusing on mitigating the risks of Denial of Service (DoS) attacks and the strategic management of transaction challenges ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/the-ark-case-for-ctv/1528/8)). Lastly, the conversation led by garlonicon on the preference for tweaking inputs over outputs for blockchain transactions underlined the importance of adaptability in cryptographic practices to address changes, commitments, and potential future soft forks, ensuring security and functionality within the ecosystem ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/is-there-a-social-approach-to-the-quantum-problem/1537/6)).

Together, these discussions reflect a vibrant and diverse dialogue on the evolving landscape of Bitcoin and blockchain technology, spanning from technical improvements and protocol updates to theoretical analyses of Bitcoin's role in economic systems.

recent_posts.title: UTXO probing attack using payjoin
recent_posts.summary:
- Payjoin offers an alternative, privacy-enhancing protocol for Bitcoin transactions, allowing optional receiver participation.
- It discusses the challenges of maintaining privacy due to the inherent risk of information disclosure in on-chain payments.
- Technical and implementation nuances of Payjoin, including its adoption hurdles and security considerations, are analyzed.

recent_posts.title: Finished planned work on BIP 3: Updated BIP Process
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine believes BIP3 is ready for implementation and seeks feedback from peers.
- He adjusted the Consensus Cleanup and Miniscript BIP drafts to align with BIP3.
- Antoine supports BIP3's current state, indicating this with "tested ACK."

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 29.0 release candidate is available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version v29.0rc2 release candidate is now available for download.
- The release is part of the final testing phase, aiming to address any critical issues.
- Community feedback is crucial for the v29.0 final version's refinement and success.

recent_posts.title: A Game-Theoretic Approach to Bitcoin’s Valuation in Equilibrium
recent_posts.summary:
- The analysis supports Bitcoin's dominance for stabilizing the macroeconomy without external intervention.
- Bitcoin's unique traits make it suitable as a universal unit of account to encourage stability.
- Transitioning to Bitcoin could reduce monetary instabilities, promising greater economic stability.

recent_posts.title: The Ark case for CTV
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion focuses on using CheckTemplateVerify (CTV) to improve Lightning payments' security and efficiency in Ark.
- It explores strategies to mitigate DoS attacks and risks of preimage non-disclosure, including trust-reliant methods with the Lightning Service Provider.
- Despite CTV's benefits, the risk of liquidity being locked by withheld preimages remains, highlighting the need for ongoing risk mitigation.

recent_posts.title: Is there a social approach to the quantum problem?
recent_posts.summary:
- Tweaking inputs is favored over modifying outputs in blockchain transactions for simplicity.
- Future soft forks may introduce transaction commitments without invalidating existing formats.
- Continuous upgradeability in cryptography is vital against emerging threats, as shown by SHA-256's adaptability.

today_in_history_posts.title: Proposal: Bitcoin Secure Multisig Setup
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The BSMS BIP aims to standardize secure multisig wallet setup across vendors.
- It introduces a two-round communication for multisig configuration with AES encryption.
- Utilizes a temporary secret TOKEN and descriptor CHECKSUM for added security layers.

today_in_history_posts.title: Increase channel-jamming capital requirements by not counting dust HTLCs
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Eugene from Crypt-iQ suggests increasing capital requirements for channel-jamming attacks.
- He proposes trimming dust HTLC outputs to prevent low-capital attackers from jamming channels.
- This measure aims to raise the costs of attacks without affecting channel throughput.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies include passive holding and active engagement with assets.
- Passive investment faces issues like the principal/agent problem, affecting asset utilization.
- The article explores using Bitcoin to back a new inflationary currency for economic stability.
